column1: What is the scope of an EC2 security group?
A security group is tied to a region and can be assigned only to instances in the same region. You can't enable an instance to communicate with an instance
outside its region using security group rules. Traffic
from an instance in another region is seen as WAN bandwidth.

column1: What is true of the way that encryption works with EBS?
